news.title: Jim Gavin’s family deeply hurt as he fights back against ‘malicious’ smears being spread online amid presidential race
news.summary: Presidential candidate Jim Gavin is ­fighting “malicious smears” about his private life that have spread across social media since he was declared as Fianna Fáil’s choice for Áras an Uachtaráin.

news.title: ‘I had questions about Katie Simpson and I have questions here’ – former detective’s concern over case of woman (23) found dead in Monaghan canal
news.summary: A former police officer who investigated the murder of showjumper Katie Simpson has raised concerns over the unexplained death of a young woman found in a Monaghan canal.

news.title: Race to the Áras: Gareth Sheridan narrowly misses out on Meath nomination; Steen looks to close in on 20 Oireachtas backers
news.summary: Follow the latest developments in our live blog:

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Mary Lou’s bags of cash could be key as Sinn Féin takes left alliance for test-drive
news.summary: There goes the last faint hope for a bit of craic. Pearse Doherty entering the presidential election would have livened it all up. The Sinn Féin frontman could have feasted on the raw meat on offer in the live debates. Alas, the lion won’t be let loose in the cage with the antelopes.

news.title: Dr Harry Barry: ‘He smashed my teeth. I’ve had four operations. After the last one the doctor said, there is nothing more I can do’
news.summary: It’s a long way from Holles Street to the African Bush. But when Dr ­Harry Barry’s wife, Brenda, began to go into labour with their second child in rural Tanzania, the experience gained as a young medic in the Irish maternity hospital stood to him.

news.title: Pat Spillane: Welcome to the crazy, crazy world of the GAA club championships, where player welfare means little
news.summary: I met a fella during the week; let’s call him a fair-weather GAA supporter who goes to Kerry’s big matches and an occasional club fixture.

news.title: Donald Trump calls Charlie Kirk an ‘American hero’ at memorial as he says he ‘hates’ his opponents
news.summary: President Donald Trump has said that he “hates” his political opponents moments after Erika Kirk, the widow of slain conservative activist Charlie Kirk, forgave her husband’s killer in an emotional tribute at his memorial.

news.title: More over 65s need to stay in the workforce, Central Bank boss warns
news.summary: People will need to work beyond what is currently considered to be the ‘typical’ retirement age if living standards are to be maintained, the Central Bank governor Gabriel Makhlouf has warned.

news.title: ‘The Traitors Ireland’ episode 10: bromance, mean girls and the most brutal banishment yet
news.summary: Warning: Contains spoilers for ‘The Traitors Ireland’ episode three from the beginning

news.title: Ask Allison: We have a fifth child on the way and we’re overstretched – my wife is unrealistic with our time and money
news.summary: Question:  We are expecting our fifth child – a little bit of a surprise, and one we are happy about. We have four healthy, lovely, sporty kids and weekends are bonkers with our various sports, training, and matches... Sometimes it feels like trying to run a taxi service, a restaurant and a launderette!
